text:
Justice Legislation Miscellaneous Amendments Act 2020

An Act to amend the Sentencing Act 1997 , the Criminal Law (Detention and Interrogation) Act 1995 and the Criminal Code
[Royal Assent 28 September 2020]

Be it enacted by Her Excellency the Governor of Tasmania, by and with the advice and consent of the Legislative Council and House of Assembly, in Parliament assembled, as follows:

PART 1 - Preliminary

1. Short title
    This Act may be cited as the Justice Legislation Miscellaneous Amendments Act 2020 .

2. Commencement
    The provisions of this Act commence on a day or days to be proclaimed.

PART 2 - Criminal Code Act 1924 Amended

[Uncommenced]

3. Principal Act
    In this Part, the Criminal Code Act 1924 is referred to as the Principal Act.

4.
    The amendments effected by this section have been incorporated into the authorised version of the Criminal Code Act 1924 .

PART 3 - Criminal Law (Detention and Interrogation) Act 1995 Amended

5.
    The amendments effected by this Part have been incorporated into the authorised version of the Criminal Law (Detention and Interrogation) Act 1995 .

6.
    The amendments effected by this Part have been incorporated into the authorised version of the Criminal Law (Detention and Interrogation) Act 1995 .

PART 4 - Sentencing Act 1997 Amended

7.
    The amendments effected by this Part have been incorporated into the authorised version of the Sentencing Act 1997 .

8.
    The amendments effected by this Part have been incorporated into the authorised version of the Sentencing Act 1997 .

9.
    The amendments effected by this Part have been incorporated into the authorised version of the Sentencing Act 1997 .

PART 5 - Concluding Provision

10. Repeal of Act
    This Act is repealed on the first anniversary of the day on which the last uncommenced provision of this Act commenced.
